photo.caption: Site of Steventon Rectory where Jane was born in 1775 and where she lived until 1800
Steventon Church where Jane worshipped for 25 years
Inside Steventon Church
Plaque commemorating Jane
Grave of Jane's brother James and his second wife, Mary
Plaque commemorating the fact that Jane and Cassandra attended school briefly in Southampton
The Abbey Gatehouse in Reading where the girls had a second attempt at school
Deane Gate Inn where the Austen's boarded the coach to London
The Wheatsheaf where Jane collected post after a walk across the fields
Site of the Basingstoke Assembly Rooms where the Austen's attended dances
Ibthorpe Manor, the home of Mary and Martha Lloyd - two sisters who both married brothers of Jane
Ashe Rectory where Jane met young Tom Lefroy
The entrance to the Manydown estate where Jane received her only offer of marriage from Harris Biggs Wither
The beamed building - now a pub - is on the site of 3 Castle Square, Southampton where Jane and Cassandra lived with their mother, Martha Lloyd and the family of Francis from 1807 - 1809
One of Southampton's points on a 'Jane Austen Trail'
The Dolphin Hotel in Southampton where Jane had an 18th birthday party
Chawton Cottage where the Austen ladies and Martha Lloyd lived from 1809 onwards
Chawton House owned by Janes' brother Edward Austen Knight
Chawton Church where the family worshipped
Inside Chawton Church
Pew in memory of Jane
The graves of the two Cassandras - mother and daughter
Henry's bank in Alton
The Swan Inn in Alton where the London coach was boarded
The house in College Street, Winchester where Cassandra took seriously ill Jane to consult a doctor and where she died in 1817
Winchester Cathedral where Jane is buried
The north aisle of the cathedral where there is a memorial plaque and window as well as the grave in the floor
Jane's gravestone - the wording composed by Henry
